queries.queryString:
(_view=sumologic_search_usage_per_query) not query_type=sumo*
user_name={{user_name}} query={{query_pattern}} query_type={{query_type}} analytics_tier={{tier}}
| where query matches /{{query_regex}}/
| ((query_end_time - query_start_time ) /1000 / 60 ) as time_range_m
//| sort execution_duration_ms
| avg(execution_duration_ms) as avg_exec_ms,count as searches, sum(data_scanned_bytes) as data_scanned_bytes, sum(data_retrieved_bytes) as data_retrieved_bytes , sum(retrieved_message_count) as retrieved_events,avg(time_range_m) as avg_time_range_m by user_name,query_type,query,scanned_partition_count,is_aggregate,analytics_tier,status_message //,session_id
| round((data_scanned_bytes /1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as scan_gbytes
| round((data_retrieved_bytes/1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as retrieved_gbytes
| round(avg_exec_ms / 1000) as avg_exec_s
| parse regex field = query "(?i)(?<meta>_sourcename|_sourcecategory|_source|_sourcehost|_collector) *(?<op>=|matches|in)[ \"]*(?<value>[\w+\*\",/-]+)\"*"
| replace(value,"\"","") as value

| sum(searches) as searches, sum(scan_gbytes) as scan_gbytes, sum(retrieved_events) as retrieved_events, max(scanned_partition_count) as scanned_partitions by user_name, query_type,meta,value,analytics_tier | sort meta asc, user_name asc
//| sort avg_exec_ms

(_view=sumologic_search_usage_per_query) not query_type=sumo*
user_name={{user_name}} query={{query_pattern}} query_type={{query_type}} analytics_tier={{tier}}
| where query matches /{{query_regex}}/
| ((query_end_time - query_start_time ) /1000 / 60 ) as time_range_m
//| sort execution_duration_ms
| avg(execution_duration_ms) as avg_exec_ms,count as searches, sum(data_scanned_bytes) as data_scanned_bytes, sum(data_retrieved_bytes) as data_retrieved_bytes , sum(retrieved_message_count) as retrieved_events,avg(time_range_m) as avg_time_range_m by user_name,query_type,query,scanned_partition_count,is_aggregate,analytics_tier,status_message //,session_id
| round((data_scanned_bytes /1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as scan_gbytes
| round((data_retrieved_bytes/1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as retrieved_gbytes
| round(avg_exec_ms / 1000) as avg_exec_s
| parse regex field = query "(?i)(?<meta>_sourcename|_sourcecategory|_source|_sourcehost|_collector) *(?<op>=|matches|in)[ \"]*(?<value>[\w+\*\",/-]+)\"*"
| replace(value,"\"","") as value

| count_distinct(user_name) as users, sum(searches) as searches, sum(scan_gbytes) as scan_gbytes, sum(retrieved_events) as retrieved_events, max(scanned_partition_count) as scanned_partitions by query_type,meta,value,analytics_tier | sort meta asc, value asc
//| sort avg_exec_ms

(_view=sumologic_search_usage_per_query) not query_type=sumo*
user_name={{user_name}} query={{query_pattern}} query_type={{query_type}} analytics_tier={{tier}}
| where query matches /{{query_regex}}/

| limit 1000
| ((query_end_time - query_start_time ) /1000 / 60 ) as time_range_m
//| sort execution_duration_ms
| avg(execution_duration_ms) as avg_exec_ms,count as searches, sum(data_scanned_bytes) as data_scanned_bytes, sum(data_retrieved_bytes) as data_retrieved_bytes , sum(retrieved_message_count) as retrieved_events,avg(time_range_m) as avg_time_range_m by user_name,query_type,query,scanned_partition_count,is_aggregate,analytics_tier,status_message //,session_id
| round((data_scanned_bytes /1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as scan_gbytes
| round((data_retrieved_bytes/1024/1024/1024) * 10 )/10 as retrieved_gbytes
| round(avg_exec_ms / 1000) as avg_exec_s
| parse regex field = query "(?i)(?<meta>_sourcename|_sourcecategory|_source|_sourcehost|_collector) *(?<op>=|matches|in)[ \"]*(?<value>[\w+\*\",/-]+)\"*"
| replace(value,"\"","") as value

| sum(searches) as searches, sum(scan_gbytes) as scan_gbytes, sum(retrieved_events) as retrieved_events, max(scanned_partition_count) as scanned_partitions by user_name, query_type,meta,value,analytics_tier,query | sort meta asc, value asc, query asc
//| sort avg_exec_ms

panels.title: About
panels.text:
This dashboard uses the Search Audit index. metadata strings are parsed out using parse regex multi to give a filterable view of what users are querying.


You can filter by various filters. note:
- the regex query filter is very powerful but also slower
- other filters are vs a column before the first | so must match the whole colum for example ```*value*``` but are case insensitive
